properties.Title: Tres Zapotes
properties.Description: The Olmec people were an ancient civilization believed to be the first to use cacao beans. Olmec pots called "tecomates" that date back to around 1500 BCE, were found to have traces of theobromine, a compound commonly found in chocolate.

properties.Title: Tikal
properties.Description: Mayans were an ancient civilization that used chocolate during important celebrations, transactions, and ceremonies. Almost all Mayans enjoyed chocolate with their meals, combining it with chili peppers, honey, or water. They'd drink it hot or cold, either way it was caffeniated.

properties.Title: Tenochtitlán
properties.Description: The Aztecs called chocolate "Xocolatl." The upper-class drank it commonly while the lower-class saved it for celebrations. Cacao beans were used as currency. The Aztec king Montezuma II drank multiple cups of xocolatl everyday, and kept many cacao beans in reserve next to his gold.

properties.Title: Spain
properties.Description: Chocolate first entered Europe through Spain in the earlier 1500's. Spain started importing chocolate in 1585.

properties.Title: Italy
properties.Description: Another European country that explored Central America and found cacao is Italy. Francesco Carletti, an Italian merchant and explorer, discovered cacao in El Salvador.

properties.Title: France
properties.Description: France also brought cacao to Europe from Central America. Eventually, chocolate was all over Europe.

properties.Title: Europe
properties.Description: Cacao plantations, with enslaved workers, began popping up in order to feed Europe's hunger for chocolate.
properties.Image Credit: Alliance of Bioversity International and CIAT on Flickr.com

properties.Title: Ghana
properties.Description: Today, cacao farmers are extremely underpaid, so they use slaves on the farms. Some of these slaves are children. Due to these unpaid workers, Ghana is the second highest country in cacao production.
properties.Image Credit: Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security on Flickr.com

properties.Title: Côte d'Ivoire
properties.Description: The country with the most cacao production is Côte d'Ivoire. They also have the most cacao farms with child/slave labor.

properties.Title: The Hershey Company Headquarters
properties.Description: The big chocolate brands, like Hershey and Mars, are underpaying cacao farmers, forcing the farmers to rely on cheap labor. Adult labor is more expensive than slavery or child labor.
